one_reviews_text: Although this was one of the earlier oculus VR games, it is unique in that it can be played seated with an xbox controller. I enjoyed my time with it and it took about 4 hours to complete. It still felt like a full game but I would not go back to it. The graphics were nice, gameplay and story were interesting enough to keep me playing. I played with Quest 2 using airlink, had to turn up supersampling to 1.5 using oculus tray tool to get it looking good. Overall I would recommend it on sale or with a voucher for around $10 or less.

Intresting game definetly worth to check it. I never run to any kind of problems and especially sickness from vr. It has something that it makes you wonder if any of this is even real on this journy you will get in to it. It was fun and scary i give it 8/10

i'm a long time vr gamer, since it started with the og vive in 2016. i had this game in my library for a long time but never played it until yesterday. finished it today. i grabbed an old xbox controller i still had lying around and sat on the couch to start this little adventure. i was expecting to be dissapointed as this game is pretty old but really enjoyed the feeling of sitting down playing vr for once! i expected playing with the xbox controller to suck, but it really didn't. it was all pretty intuitive. 
after playing first person vr for so long this third person vr game felt refreshing and i feel like there should be more games like this! 
the story is simple but you keep going to know more, some pretty epic moments that made me go wtf!!
graphics were not all that impressive but it really didn't matter, you should have seen the stuff we played in 2016 holy crap! i didn't encounter any bugs and everything went smooth so extra points for that. 
replayability wise this might take me a while to play again, but i really loved the ride!

review_title: One of the best VR games.
one_reviews_text: This is a truly great game.  Even if it wasn't in VR, I think I would enjoy it.  But being in VR makes it even better.  The graphics are great, the performance is perfect, the story is interesting, and the world is exciting.  VR needs more of these kinds of games!

I'm a little late to the party on this one. I initially held off from buying this game, mostly due to its rather lukewarm reception, plus the fact that this was a game released in VR's early era. And having played it, it does have a few dated aspects. The textures are a little rough, the resolution is rendered at a lower resolution, likely the same res as the CV1, and there's no sort of graphics settings to mess with. Despite all this, it's actually not as bad as it might sound. The textures while muddy, are usually naturally obscured by the darkness of the game. And despite the resolution being lower, it actually wasn't that distracting even on a Quest 2 (though if you really want to, you can probably force the resolution up via the Oculus Debug Tool). This is a third person game, and while I wouldn't say it's really a good showcase of what VR can be like, I don't think this game would be better off without VR. I can't really report on how clunky the controls feel on Touch controllers, but using a gamepad was surprisingly intuitive. And the story is a total mindbend. Ever since I got to the ending, this game has been on my mind ever since. I'm not even gonna say what the ending is like, I'll leave that to you. The game is unfortunately rather short though, I managed to beat it in about 2 sittings, I think it was like 6 hours total.

TL;DR: slightly dated, but not too bad. Good story, but sorta short for price. It might be a little short for $20, but if you happen to get a $10 credit or 30% discount, then give this a shot.

I'm sure in 2016 or whenever this game was passable. I really can't understand all the 4 and 5 star reviews here for this overpriced title. 

Okay, maybe if you're a massive Lovecraft fan, which I'm not, this could be enjoyable. Not to mention the game is very short around 3 hours. 

They got motion control support, but only barely. All of the in game tutorials show an xbox controller and are not intuitive at all. Every movement seems awkward. The core gameplay loop is just not good, extremely boring and not scary in any way. Anyone saying this game is scary has not played anything good in VR.

Finally, the biggest reason I can't play this game more than 5 minutes is the graphics. With no in game options to adjust graphics you are sitting here with a 3rd person outdated animated HP Lovecraft visual novel running at barely PS2 level detail. Do you really think this is worth $30? Come on, Meta.

I was playing this with a link cable on Quest 2 with a 3080 Ti and set to 120 fps at 1.9x resolution, still was visually atrocious and made no difference. This game could be better if the devs fixed the render scale and added graphics options and decent control scheme but until then, do yourself a favor and look elsewhere.
If you want to play a VR game that perfectly suits the foreboding nature of Lovecraft horror, you don't want to miss this game!

I usually don't write reviews but I've just finished the game and I'm pickng my jaw from the floor...  Great story, great atmosphere. Third person perspective  is a plus for me - sometimes I like to sit and play with cotroller. 
If you like horror/adventure games then you have to play it. Espacially if you are a Lovecraft fan.
Good History
Especially since it was made so early in the life cycle of VR, this game is still pretty amazing. Great story, interesting lore, and awesome 3rd person gameplay!

This game is a bit dated at this point, but still really enjoyable. The 3rd person (sonethimes 1st person) thing is a little awkward at times and trying to platform jump and stuff can be stupidly frustrating (survive a host of monsters just to walk off a ledge just feels so dumb). Also, some of the gameplay (like the ice wall climbing) gets kinda stale after a while. All that being said, the environments are awesome. The story is enjoyable. The whole Lovecraft in the arctic feel is fun and unique. And there aren't a lot of vr games like this, which makes the whole thing refreshing. I really enjoyed it.

I’m quite new to VR; the Quest 2 being my first VR headset, and I’m thoroughly enjoying this game, playing it now in 2021.

The visuals are awesome and the game has a wonderfully creepy atmosphere, and a gripping story that hooks you in. 

I’m playing on a Ryzen 5 5600x and RX 6700 XT and the game runs great. I’ve even set the render resolution to 1.4 in the Link software and it still plays extremely smoothly. 

If you like the more recent Tomb Raider games or the Batman series, you’ll love this.

Edge of Nowhere ranks up there with my favourite VR games so far; Half Life Alyx, Lone Echo and Moss. 

For £14.99 it’s a steal. Just get it.

Amazing cinematics and storyline packed into a terrifying survival horror 3rd person VR platformer package. Insomniac games outdid themselves again. Still mindblowing and a top tier VR experience in 2021. Ran flawlessly on my rift S and RTX 3080.

Game is pretty good overall-- though I am not a fan of the ending.
My review though will focus on the terrible controls. Granted this was optimized for a gamepad and not yet for the Touch controllers, but the camera moves in weird perspectives as you move, thus making it hard to natural adapt to the movement. I mean, for instance, there are times that you are moving forward, and yet the camera is almost to the side of the character, thus making you do some mental gymnastics as to how you would reflect the movement with the gamepad joystick. The key combinations to firing a gun and throwing rocks are also very unnatural. 

Gameplay wise, I found it pretty engrossing, though the fact that it was not meant as room scale and is not using the Touch controllers make it a bit dated if you're just playing it today. I mean, you can't reach out to actually "touch" the VR world-- you are controlling the character via a gamepad or the Touch controllers acting like a gamepad.

I still give it a 4 out of 5 as I do not want to bring the rating down because of my gripes with regard to how the game is controlled.

So still enjoyable, but prepare to play a bit old school VR, if you will.

Edge of Nowhere is an okay game but wasn't worth the $19.99 I paid for it. 

Many of my deaths in this game were caused by the clunky controls, given that much of this game requires you to jump from ledge to ledge, you'd expect the controls to be much tighter and more reliable.

There isn't much to this game, the enviroments are ok but boil down to "climb ice here" and "sneak around here". You spend your roughly 4 hour campaign essentially throwing rocks and jumping about a bit.

The story is okay, the voice acting is okay, be environment is okay, and the controls/core gameplay mechanics are a bit lackluster.

Graphically I found this game didn't look great even though I am running SS on max, characters in the distance looked pixelated and there are no in-game graphics options to fix this.

Overall, I'd skip this title unless it's on sale for $5-$10

It was my first vr game that had decent graphics and I loved the gameplay. It could have been a bit longer, but I gave five stars, because the ending of the game was  the most immersive vr experience in my life... I wish more developers had this kind of creativity

I've really enjoyed this game.. . Engaging graphics that run smoothly on my duo pro...

Interesting story if not slightly repetitive...but boy are the controls dreadful, switching between shot gun, running, jumping and throwing stones....is so clumsy that half the challenge is remembering what button does what....and by the time the character actually reloads or switches out the gun....your likely dead, because he's sooooo slow. 

Still I'd say one of the better games I've played on the Quest... and that includes half life.

I love the fact that your character mimics your head movement. You aim your weapon or your headlamp by looking and this forms a connection between the avatar and yourself. It's more intimate than being a spectator in a scene. 

sound design is good. story and the script are solid. enviroment design doesn't have a ton a variety but what you have is well crafted. the gameplay loop can be a bit repetetive but it does add a bit off twist at every level to keep things fresh. 

Overall I'm really impressed. It made me look for other 3rd person vr games.

one_reviews_text: Fantastic story, truley a great lovecraft game. Gameplay is fun and mechanicaly sound. I bought this game in the late 2020 and i was amazed that being from 2016 it's still very good. It´s true that is linear and simple but much fun to play, an interesting 3D perpective, great horror moments and interesting story. Clearly is worth for 20€

Got this in the sale and definitely worth every penny. It's a few hours long, entirely linear but just a simple, fun and at times scary experience with graphics that are getting a bit dated in 2020 but artistically are superb.
So beautiful....

H.P. Lovecraft is my favorite horror author. The game adapts many of his concepts and stories.
Graphics are not that high end, but because you are at antarctica... snow is just white.
The only thing i didn't like was the time to complete the game. After about 4 hours I saw the credits.
But when it's on sale, I can definitely recommend it.

The incorporation of the environment into the gameplay is stunning. I was skeptical about a 3rd person VR, but they go in another direction with what they can do with that and it is impressive. Cinematic. Always learning. Great story of the Cosmic Horror Lovecraft stuff

I just finished this game on my Quest2 with link on my Alienware. For an older game, the graphics looked just as good as newer games and the environments created by this team are second to none. (Giant Ice caves, flying over vast mountain ranges, running through a rain forest).  This is a 3rd person game which some have complained about, but It worked beautifully in this story driven action/horror game. Think games like Moss. The 3rd person view reduces motion sickness and makes you care about the character.  I completed this in just over 6 hours and stayed until the end credits. This game has an original soundtrack and is linear game. It is suspenseful, beautiful and filled with action and horror elements. If metal Gear Solid, Laura Croft and HP Lovecraft had a baby this would be it. I removed a star because I died a lot . The game gets progressively difficult.  There is also a lot of climbing ice cliffs with ice picks but each is a little different with having to jump to the side to avoid obstacles, repel down ropes, jump over caverns etc. so it at least keeps things interesting and is very exciting when you complete the task and move to the next scene.  I usually hate games where I die repeatedly but this game at least has frequent save points and I stayed until the end for the story and amazing environments.

review_title: A Lightweight Copy of Better Games
one_reviews_text: This was an okay adventure that lifted gameplay elements from more successful games to tell a mildly horror / sci-fi narrative. This game primarily takes from the Tomb Raider series: the radio chats, the journal readings, the exact animations from icepick climbing to melee attacks to throwing rocks, not to mention literally raiding a tomb. The storyline is just Lost Planet, except set in the past, with Lovecraft vibes. The game is short (3-4 hours), linear (no secrets or alternate routes), and redundant (climbing section, stealth combat section, psychological story section, repeat), there is only one boss which is overly simplistic and short, and the technical issues of first-person story sections feels disjointed (if you turn your head you'll see your character's headless body), but it's still an acceptable game for the $5 spent. There are other third person games which handle this story and gameplay better, such as Chronos and Hellblade: Senua's Sacrific, if you're interested.

The real draw to this title is the story, interweaving great elements across time/space with breathtaking and incredibly imaginative landscapes - sometimes it is just cool to walk and look around. Highly recommend this - still an excellent game in Dec 2020.

one_reviews_text:
...mean that I can give it a lower score? I sure think so.

This is a game meant to be played with Xbox controller. But you still have the option to only use touch. - That's just fine IMO. Though I didn't expect it to be a seated experience. Another older game that I've gotten around to in my libary. It has a few weaknesses such as inability to adjust the camera angle but everything else makes up for it. Think lara croft meets Lovecraft. Cool story and enjoyable game and was fairly lengthy at 4 hours for me to play. Give it a try!

I got onto the VR train rather early with the Rift CV1 back in 2016-ish and this was one of the first full length games I tried. I have always been a huge H.P. Lovecraft fan and when I saw a trailer for this I was in. Full length, complete, and cohesive narrative-based single player VR experiences are pretty few and far between.  Even now in 2020 there are really only a handful of games that don't just feel like a tech demo or just a neat gameplay hook fleshed out into a game. Edge of Nowhere though is FANTASTIC. It has an intriguing, emotional plot to keep you going, and I found myself on 2 or 3 hour marathon sessions in just this game. 

The 3rd person VR gameplay isn't one that I've seen done this well in many games. You expect it to be difficult or to be strange to be the camera as your character runs around, but I found it to be pleasant. No issues with VR sickness for anyone that has tried it that I've seen yet. I think because it's not first person, your brain doesn't struggle to reconcile what you're seeing with what you're feeling. If you have played Lucky's Tale or Chronos, this will feel very familiar. 

I loved the interesting perspective, and the devs use it to great effect. When you see a Great Old One walking across Antarctica with as little regard for you as an ant, the perspective really highlights that classic Lovecraftian existential dread as you come to terms with just how insignificant you are on a cosmic scale, where creatures can be the size of planets, you are little more than a flea. The devs wanted to make you feel small next to these horrors, and they succeeded. 

Whenever one of my friends gets into VR or is on the hunt for a new game to play, I always recommend this game as one of my top three experiences, and so far I haven't had anyone tell me didn't enjoy their time with it. Even my friend who HATES horror and thinks of Lovecraft as excessively verbose and long-winded, enjoyed her time with this one. I'm sure you will too.

very good ! a smooth terrific experience , i'll wait for the next work of the studio !
you can blind buy it :)

I am not very far into the game. Just started encountering the big glowing sea urchin looking monsters. But I have also peaked at some of this game's screenshots further into the gameplay, which look amazing. This game is so beautiful and creepy. So far feels like if Lovecraft's horror stories and John Carpenter's movie "The Thing" had a baby, this game would be it.

2 little flaws, which if it wasn't for them, the game would be 6 out of 5 stars!

1. It feels awkward that toggle on the left controlled does both moving and turning, while right toggle only switches on health and weapons stats. I am constantly using right toggle to turn, and get the darn stats instead >:(

2. MOST IMPORTANT: The game would be so much scrarier and immersive if it was 1st person instead of 3rd person. I see a few other reviews mentioning that too. Why oh why wasn't it made in 1st person?
For 2016, it is a masterpiece!!
Well made 3rd person Lovecraft Game. A real gem in my humble opinion since you wouldn't expect an early VR title to be A: a lovecraft game B: well made, and C: quite lengthy compared to other titles.

Honestly, I could say the same for most H.P. Lovecraft based games, but this one is excellent.  Now, it is a game made before the Touch controllers got released, making it a very early VR title, but don't let that hold you back, just get comfy and watch madness unravel before your eyes with gameplay heavily inspired by the likes of Uncharted and Last of Us.  
Due to it being an early VR game, the graphical settings are nonexistant, forcing me to use Oculus Tray Tool to get the resolution up to at least the native resolution of my Quest headset, but even supersampled, this game runs without a problem on my RX 5700 XT.  
The only issues I could put towards it is just from the fact that it isn't what one expects from VR these days (could easily be done without VR), and it is a bit short at 5-6 hours with almost no replay value, but for $15-20 that's completely worth it.   Insomniac, even at half effort makes quality entertainment.
It would have definitely been better as a console game

I expected this to be a lot shorter for some reason but every time I felt like the game was coming to its climax I was plunged straight back into the nightmare again.  It was a most(ly) enjoyable six or seven hours  although I'm not sure I'd do another playthrough. It's linear so there isn't anything you can miss really plus I'm not sure I'd want to live through the negative aspects again (more on this below). It's definitely one of the better VR games out there and was beautiful to look at, if a bit repetitive in places after a time.
I enjoyed the third person perspective and thought it worked well although the ability to change the camera's vantage point might have been beneficial at times. I found myself looking over my shoulder occasionally when needing to double back on myself with the camera remaining pointed at whatever angle the devs thought worked best. 
The controls mostly worked but not seemlessly. On some of the scenes requiring lots of jumping I found myself dying a lot. Fortunately the game puts you back to the last checkpoint which is usually fairly close but repetition-until-success is a game mechanic I thought had died out in the 80s. The climactic scene suffered from this for me and having to make repeat attempts (dozens rather than hundreds) at it wasn't fun or challenging but annoying and spoiled the immersion somewhat. I've deducted a star for that as I do feel it spoilt an otherwise very enjoyable dungeon romp. Those instances were limited to just a couple of occasions and it may be my (lack of) skill rather than a flaw in the game's design. But you just had to have the joystick slightly off direction and down the cliff you'd go again and it seemed a bit fiddly.
To conclude I'd definitely recommend this game for its stunning visuals if you're prepared to overlook some of its minor quirks. It's a stealth / tactical game rather than a brute force gun fest so if you're after the latter you may want to overlook this one.
My favorite game other than Beat Sabre. This game was so fun to play and scary at times!

We need more games like this..
I dont always want to have to wave my arms an dance around my living room to play vr. Games like this one, and for example Hellblade,are a perfect example for a great stoytelling experience with the advantages of VR. I wish devs would create more games like this,or have vr support in there titles(Jedi fallen order in VR for example) 1 can only hope,in the meantime,buy this one if u like tomb raider style games.
I love these style of games! The story is great and the gameplay is perfect! We definitely need more rested games with long play! This is a great game and I hope we get more just like it.

VR is great for putting us in the center amazing worlds but there is something to be said about playing through a game old school style with a controller and being immersed in those worlds as well. This game does an Excellent job of this and I wish their were more. More Zelda, Tomb Raider, Uncharted, God of War, Resident Evil style games played like this game so I can give my old bones a rest and sit and play without swinging my body around like Havok physics from time to time. As Mr Miagi would say "Balance Danielson" :)

First VR game that took me over early on.  Good story goodmachanics. I liked the third person view because the story was built around the main character and I enjoyd watching his journey. The length was surprising. This is where VR is and should be heading. on a side note somone give me pilot wings please and having a legit easy way to play any game easily in vr with just a controller would be amazing. I would play the wither wild hunt and just be in heaven.
I really enjoyed the story here, the journey through the ice, the Lovecraft vibes. We need a lot more like this in VR!
One of the best overall games I've played. Well worth $20!

I loved this game. But a forced 3rd person view in VR is a mistake in my opinion. 

I get that it reduces nausea by giving eyes a focus that doesn't change relative positions. But give a player the option to choose immersion over sim sickness - some of us have no issues with motion. Especially for horror titles - watching someone being chased by creatures fades in compassion to actually being chased in first person.

Other than that, the game is A-MA-ZING! Beautiful environments, clever puzzles, a solid story - all bonuses that make this an adventure worth owning.

review_title: One of the best VR has to offer!
one_reviews_text: I've been playing a number of games including some big titles.  However this game is one of my absolute favourites!  The graphics, atmosphere, story-line and game play are absolutely fantastic!  This game is a must for every VR enthousiastic who loves a good mix of adventure and horror.

VR is dominated by "being" the character. See what it's like playing a game where you simply control the character when a game is designed to be played in VR. Part platformer and part survival horror wrapped with a Lovecraft style bow. It's not 100% perfect but it's incredibly entertaining with lots of amazing moments and a sense of scale and dread few games can match. I want more titles like this.

There is nothing interesting/unique in Edge of Nowhere. You have mediocre stealth segments which make up the brunt of gameplay, terribly boring climbing segments that serve no other purpose than padding out the game's runtime, forgetable uncharted/tomb raider-esque setpieces, and a story that is not only less interesting than the sources EoN takes inspiration from, but also features the most played-out, uninteresting twist that you have seen countless times before.

The monster designs are decent enough, but there are only 4 monsters, excluding the annyoing urchin-things and the wall-spore-spitters, and you've seen the extent of possible encounters that this sandbox provides in no time at all. Even on the hardest difficulty, supplies were plentiful enough, and given how death has no real consequence, there's nothing to stop the bored/impatient player from brute-forcing their way through each encounter.

Gameplay is most similar to Cabela's Sirvival; Shadows of Katmai and Crash Bandicoot. Yes, that is a sentence I thought I'd never say; but these are strange times we live in. You control your character from a third person perspective, and the camera is always facing forwards. You aim by moving your head, and thats about as far as the game goes to take advantage of being a VR game. It is incredibly derivative of other, better games that you have played before, and being in VR only further accentuates how this game brings nothing of value to the table. Sure, you can look around, and sometimes there will be something looking at you from the shadows, and that's about as exciting as things get.

This game is something you can safely skip. You really are missing out on nothing if you choose not to play this. VR games from a thrid person perspective are great, and do work very well, Moss and Chronos are great examples of games that utilize VR in creative and imaginative ways. Edge of Nowhere is a relic of a time long gone, when no one knew what to do with VR.

I enjoyed every minute of it, this is probably one of the very few lovecraftian games that actually nails the athmosphere and wonder of a Lovecraft story.
Everything you see will horrify you and yet you'll wanna explore more, and know where this adventure will take you.
The world design is nothing short of amazing, the sound design is creepy and spot on, it will make you chill. 
The gameplay is simple but enjoyable. Personally i recommend anyone with some gaming experience to play at the hardest difficulty level, it will just lower your max ammunitions, and it will make for a more challenging and tense and experience.
Only negative note, in my opinion, are a couple of "cheap" jumpscares through the game, but if you've watched a reasonable amount of horror movie in your life, you'll know exactly where to expect them.
Overall a great game that you should certainly play whether you're a Lovecraft fan or not.

Bought this game way back when it was released (had Vive and wanted to play it on Revive). I only quickly tested it tough. It seemed interesting, but the novelty of being in 1st person and having hands in VR was all the rage back then. Also, lots of white colour didn't lend itself too well to low res and strong SDE of first gen VR hmds.

Fast forward 3 years. I just switched to Rift S and when looking for a game to play next I decided to give Edge of Nowhere another try. Wow, I'm glad I waited. The crispness of Rift S screen, higher res and minimal SDE makes the game look gorgeous! Even better, the gameplay itself is awesome! I love it. Very interesting story as well.

Anyway, one of the VR classics that aged really well!

Since it's still somewhat short, I would expect most people should wait for a sale or bundle on this one. If you do though, it's a really cool experience. It's actually longer than a lot of VR games, and the gameplay is pretty well designed and challenging. You don't get any neat touch interactions, but stealth and combat are solid enough, with a good number of giant vistas and monsters to add visual appeal. Using simple rock throws to clear an entire room of enemies felt very fun.
Cool story, feels immersive enough to try other VR games, great setting for Cthulhu fans. Unfortunatelly very short and one-time action for couple of hours. Definetelly get it on sale.

review_title: Wow! What a game! Just finished it..
one_reviews_text: Took awhile..Longer than expected..Very entertaining and well paced. When you die it brings you almost same spot, unlimited lives which is great. Love how you can kill your enemies with those spikes. Excellent mechanics.. Hoping they make a second one! Recommended!
I bought this a long time ago but have only got around to playing it.  Wow, so much fun, so nice to look at and a great story too.

review_title: Not a bad game if you catch it on sale
one_reviews_text: I got this game half off for like 10 bucks. Beat it in one sitting of a few hours on the middle difficulty (there are 3), though I doubt I'll ever replay it. I enjoy the third person perspective of this game and I wish more VR games did this sort of style. Not a fan of the ending, but that's subjective. The lovecraftian areas are nice to look at. It's clear that a lot of work went into this game. Gameplay gets a little repetitive though. It might be more enjoyable in shorter bursts rather than finishing it in one long sitting. There was like 1 jumpscare that felt a little cheap but I guess that's what you sign up for with these kinds of games.
If you want to seat down and relax and enjoy a game . This is it ! Keeps me entertained! Great graphics and gameplay! Brilliant story!

Bought this game not expecting to much but was really suprised how much i really enjoyed this game. 
The game really sucks you in with its atmosphere and mystery, not the best graphics but it gets the job done, The game could have been a little longer, you finish the game in around 3 hours time. works great on the Rift s.
I am gonna wait a couple of days and then play it again, would not mind a sequel.

Not a bad a game at all.
It's not very long (completed it in one sitting) but it was still alot of fun to play through. Great atmosphere and graphics. It also was not riddled with senseless jump scares. Solid game.

I love playing this game. I have played it at least 10 Times because i just love how it looks on the Rift S even tho it is an older game. I hope they make another one that is more up to date with the newer headsets because it would look even better. It sucks me in everytime I play it. Great Job!

Great experience. 
Very atmospheric.
It reminds me of Call of Cthulhu.
Good graphics and design

This game has good art assets, good sound, great immersion. It has some solid although not fully polished game mechanics- that probably could of went farther but is fine for what it is. Game length is decent. It is a terrific experience with many great memorable action sequences.

However, the story was cliche and so so. This is typical, run of the mill, yawn video game storytelling. And there are many gratuitous obnoxious jump scares. That is cheap and compels me to give 4 stars-- I was leaning towards 3. 

The gameplay ending was anticlimatic, the cutscene ending was decent.

review_title: I usually hate these types of games
one_reviews_text: This game is freaking amazing the story line actually got my attention and had really good jump scares and twists in the game. Very well done!!!!

Insomniac is slowly cementing themselves as one of my favorite game developers ever. From the Ratchet and Clank reboot, to this, and now to Spiderman PS4. This game is deeply atmospheric and immersive even though it is in third person. And sure it takes a little while to get used to, but having the sense that you are actually in the world with your character is amazing. The story is deep, dark, unsetteling, and interesting. You feel completely hopeless in this dark and isolated world you are put into, and as your characters mental health slowly starts getting worse you will feel like you are slowly going insane. The game doesn't have a lot of jump scares, but the atmosphere and world building makes sure you never feel at ease.

Jumping over to the more technical side, playing on a GTX 970 and i5, I did have some framerate issues in certain areas of the game. However it wasn't making me feel sick or disrupting gameplay it just slightly took me out of the experience. However this was never during combat, stealth or climbing.

TL;DR play this game.
Really enjoyed this and ending alone made it five stars for me. Despite the age of the game still holds up as an amazing experience in 2019.

The graphics in this title provide an excellent atmosphere even though the game is easy to run. The beasts, story and game play are excellent. This title reminds me of the old Dead Space games I used to play and really enjoyed.  If you’re an old Dead Space fan you should buy this title if you’re not you should buy it anyway!

review_title: This is the way to go
one_reviews_text: Even so Edge of Nowhere is graphically speaking not an impressive title, the story, immersion and execution in terms of gameplay is brilliant. If the graphics were a little more on the higher end I would give 6 stars. I had a great time with this game.

review_title: AAA Game from a AAA Developer
one_reviews_text: The production values on this game are top notch.  The atmosphere, settings, gameplay, voice acting and weird story are amazing and worthy of your attention.  Apart from one weird bug that left the gun aim on or wouldn’t turn the gun aim off (which required a restart to fix) everything else about this game is perfect.  And boy, the level with the old sailing ships is a glory to behold.

I absolutely don't understand why this game has so many 5 and 4-star reviews. Sure, the graphics are nice, but that's all.
90% of this "game" is walking, running, climbing. 5% is listening to a narration. 5% is actual game (fighting with creatures, which is OK but not super fun) but with almost no difficulty. If you don't succeed at first try, you'll succeed at the second or third try - and I chose the highest level of difficulty!
To be fair, the game get a little bit more interesting toward the end, with a little bit more difficulty, and the game is relatively long considering that you are almost always moving forward. But you will finish it in 3 or 4 days, which is incredibly short.

I have really started to love 3rd person VR, after playing Chronos, Witchblood, and a couple others I decided to give this a try. So glad I did. 

Top notch atmosphere, visuals and sounds. Definitely sucks you in and makes you feel nervous and even throws the odd jump scare at you for good measure. The controls are well done and exposed to you naturally as you play through the game. At first I felt like there should have been a tutorial but you just start doing what you can do, and as you need to do new things or use items, the game guides you.

The checkpoints are frequent, and if you are like me, you will die a lot. My favourite aspect was figuring out how to get out of a given situation, while trying to conserve precious ammunition and health resources. It is definitely not a run and gun game. I played on normal and there was strategy involved. It is very satisfying when you figure out how to get past a particular set of enemies or obstacles.

There is some repetition and frustration if you die a lot, obviously, and it can get annoying. Particularly the 'running while everything is crumbling and you're being chased' sequences. It creates a great sense of urgency, but the controls are not perfect for leaping and running with all abandon. Eventually you memorize where you will need to jump and you get through, but for me those were the weakest parts of the game, although they were visually stunning and intense. I really enjoyed the quiet, tense scenes where you had to figure out how to use stealth and distraction to proceed.

The music and sound were excellent. No complaints there. The sense of emotion matched the scale and depth of the scenery. Breathtaking at times.

Overall I would recommend this highly. It felt like I got a lot of playtime out of it, and I was never bored. It wasn't perfect so I had to give it 4, but it's a solid 94% of a 4!

review_title: A great ride on the Mountains of Madness
one_reviews_text:
*** Somewhat spoiler-y review ***

***

***

I rather enjoyed it. The atmosphere was absolutely horrifying in spots, and it definitely had an "At the Mountains of Madness" feel to it. You get to travel to Providence and Miskatonic University. Plus, there is a Great Old One that might look familiar. The story line was fun, and I loved how it would interplay Antarctica with a 1930s setting.

They turned basic game play such killing monsters or navigating ice caves into puzzles. I agree with other reviews that the basic game play could get somewhat monotonous, but that puzzle approach helped to hold my interest.

Two thumbs up from this Lovecraft aficionado.

The atmosphere & visuals in this game is amazing. The story is skin-crawling delicious. There isn't great variety in mechanics, but that's about the only negative I got, and it isn't a big one as the action is very enjoyable throughout. It leaves you confused, horrified & delighted, finishing off with the most incredible ending. *Highly* recommend, 10/10

I really enjoyed this game! Truly! I'm not a big fan of horror games normally (yes, I'm somewhat of a sissy), but this one kept me coming back for more. It had just the perfect grim (and freezing) atmosphere, the gut churning moments when you almost fell into oblivion, the jump scares, the recurring need to look behind you just to make sure no monsters were following you. I would describe it like the perfect mix of Indiana Jones (or perhaps Tombraider?) and Carpenters classic The Thing. 

I only have two minor issues, forcing me to remove one star from my review...

First, it does get a bit repetative in the end. The basic game mechanic resembles the Hitman series, where you have to sneak, distract and watch out for the monsters field of view. It's never boring, but the game sure could use some more variation. 

Second, and this really irritates me, is that there is no way to replay a completed section! The ending is a truly WOW-I-CANT-BELIVE-THIS-IS-HAPPENING moment, but if you for some reason missed anything (hint: Look to your left!), you have to play through the whole friggin' game to see it again! Or ask a nice person to send you their save-game. So I guess I'll fondly recall the last hectic seconds of my adventure, knowing that it will soon fade into a distant memory.

This game surprised me. When I purchase games on oculus, I don't expect to play it straight through to the end. This game hooked me and kept me entertained for 5 hours. It was an amazing experience and worth the purchase. I own many games and this has the best atmoshere so far.

Graphics: The visuals are stunning and set the mood nicely. You find yourself feeling alone and in a dangerous enviroment. The monsters are well designed and the textures are well defined even in the environment.

Audio: The sound quality in this game is is perfect for the game. There's no unecessary music, just the sounds of the cold desolate environment and eerie monsters lurking about.

Gameplay: 
Pros: The game has a very good stealth aspect, very similar to "Last of Us". The attacks and gunplay work very well. The gunplay works with your head aiming and the controller shooting. Overall, the game combines a good mix of stealth and action.

Cons: The gameplay is a platformer with a few issues, but surely not a big deal. Touch controllers are not very intuitive and poorly implemented in this game. You need to use an Xbox controller if you want to have the optimal experience. The game just works very well when used with the controller. 
Jumping to a ledge can sometimes cause you to hang there. This issue rarely ever happened. 

Story: The story is the main draw here. It simply pulls you in and keeps you in suspense till the end. This game gets you thinking and keeps you interested. 

Replay value: Overall, this game has some replay value. There are 3 levels of difficulty and are changeable in-game. Although the story won't change, the game was good enough in my opinion for a few replays. It's definitely one of those games you beat then play again months later. Like watching a good movie more than once.

Conclusion: Overall, I believe this game is worth its value. I don't give high praise to a game lightly. This game is a well designed and implemented platformer.

I've just finished playing for two hours.  That's a long time for me, I don't usually stay in any one experience too long so that's saying a lot.  It was an all-around good experience!  Make no mistake, this is more of a "proof of concept" than a game in my opinion.  The entire duration is on rails, and it gets very tedious in some places.  It's always completely obvious where to go and what to do, and in the very few times it was not completely obvious, the exploration was tedious and boring...  The human character design is very cool!  I wish the team who designed the humans also designed the NPC bad guys.  There's a lot of good stuff going on with the over-the-shoulder mechanics, the perspective and the movement of the character.  There are a lot of problems there too.  The fact that you CANNOT turn your character around is maddening.  I get that in order for every part of the game to be on rails you can't allow people to backtrack, but it was confounding.  The lighting and procedural textures are very poorly implemented and the lighting in particular makes it impossible to suspend disbelief while playing.  Honestly the lighting is the worst part of this VR experience.  There is only one weapon in the game, and that is a shotgun that is used very sparingly.  I think this is an excellent foundation for a someday game that will be refined and perfected.  I would recommend this game because it's a very basic platformer for your Oculus, but for the VR experience I would opt for "Lucky's Tale" over this for now.

Combine Uncharted with the bad parts of final fantasy 13 and you get this game.  If you love the gameplay of Uncharted like games, then you will probably like this game well enough.  However, it is very linear, the characters are very meh, and even the "witty" protagonist comments range from unconvincing to dumb.  Out of full disclosure I loved the characters and story of the Uncharted series, but didn't love the game-play.

The controls are great most of the time, except when they aren't.  The jumping is super inconsistant... instead of you jumping a set distance, whether or not you make the jump is more tied to how close you were to the edge when you jumped.  This may be how Uncharted works as well, but with the depth perception granted by VR, it really magnifys this.  Also, some of the development was lazy.  You have a shotgun, every time you pick up ammo you get two shells, but you pick up an entire box with at least 4 shells visable.  Granted that is nitpicky... and really there isn't anything largely wrong with this game, its just for me it what a bunch of little stuff that added up to be too much.  I did finish the game out of duty (also because it is only 4 hours), but I felt bored or frustrated far more often than I felt a sense of wonder.

(This is a freeform movement game with snap turns, so expect a little vertigo at first but it's manageable.) Being an older VR game, this doesn't use the touch controllers but wants an Xbox controller instead.  This is not necessarily a bad thing; the controls are immediately familiar as you are moving Victor in third person, but the scale is all VR.  That moment in the end of the trailer when the Cthulhu-like creature looks down on you?  Yeah.  It's YUGE.  There's a moment a little ways into the game where you have to sneak around under it and then race beneath it as it looms over not just the character but you.  I kept letting my guy die because I was too busy gawking at the creature to care about him.  The platforming can be a bit tricky, but that's balanced out by a very friendly checkpoint system that doesn't throw you back very far when you die.  It's a mind-blowing experience, but also pretty spooky at times.  Mind the mature rating, brace for a little vertigo at first, and understand it pre-dates the touch controllers and you should be happy with this one.

review_title: One of the first "full" VR games
one_reviews_text: This was the first VR game I played that felt full. It wasn't just and experience or some arcade-like game, it had a good story and felt complete.

review_title: Great game, well worth the money
one_reviews_text:
Wait for it to go on sale is the first thing I will say.

This game is not overly long but it sucks you in until the very end.  The end was not what I was expecting (but I won't ruin that for anyone).

First off, watching the trailers made me want the game, they did a good job of that.  What I will say is that it is pretty basic and repetitive in terms of the games mechanics and it does get tough at times but overall was well thought out. 

Knowing this, keep in mind it was an early VR release and VR has come quite a ways since then, however it was one of the best 3rd person VR games I could think of (that is paid).  Worth picking up.

Great adventure game  and ran flawlessly on my system (although I'm not surprised).


So why did I give it 4/5 instead of a full 5 stars?  Mainly because it is fairly short and the entire game is more or less the same thing, throw a rock to distract enemies, if they see you, shoot it with your shotgun.  Other than that I believe this game is a good way to show someone new to VR the immersian a VR setup can bring even in a 3rd person environment.

What I mean is a lot of the VR games feel very short and although some are excellent you can come away thinking I wish I could pay 30pounds for a proper game instead of 8 pounds for a short game. This game for me is a 'proper game'. It doesnt feel cut short. It isnt a 50hour game though so dont expect that. What I mean is it felt like a complete game and I played through and enjoyed every minute. 
I think I got it on some sale at 2.99 so a no brainer, but it is easily worth a lot more! Highly enjoyable experience.
Epic

Nice to get a full length game thats not just an "experience" or wave shooter, some repitive sections, especially early on in the game, picks up well towards the end, a mix of a 3rd person platformer/shooter and a mild survival horror game.  Linear though and fairly basic/lacking variety, it at least feels like a proper game.  Recommended at Sale pricing.

Waited a long time to buy this game cause of the 3rd person view ,
But its exellent in this game!!
Im really glad i buyed it because its a really addictive game.
Dont let the 3rd person view hold you off from trying this game.
Its really worth the money.
excellent game love the third person idea in VR cant wait to play GTA like this and first person shooters i can only imagine BLACK OPS ZOMBIES WOULD BE AMAZING

This is one of the most immersive games and with a better history of VIRTUAL reality, its scenarios and its thematic LOVERCRAFT make it 100% necessary

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ztvdjwQPz1Y

If you love lovecraft, you will love this game. "A certain atmosphere of breathless and unexplainable dread" to say it with a Lovecraft quote.

I hope they make a second game themed like this. It takes quite some time to play trough, but I did not want it to end at all.

That game really gives me the creeps - Is is worth every minute playing. Maybe a bit too much climbing and walking through the snow - I wish there were more scenes on the ship or in the city, and yes more huge boss monster !

I wish the devs could make that the game launches oculus mirror in fullscreen mode instead of windowed so you can record the game in fullscreen. ALT+ENTER doesnt work neither. A fix would be nice for thoses like me who record videos on youtube.
A Tomb Raider game mixed with Lovecraft's "Mountains of Madness".......amazing game, superb visuals.
Good game. Disgusting monsters, and cool puzzles.
Need more games like this. The story and atmosphere are great.
Great game but extremely linear. and not much exploration involved. Would have prefered a little more freedom and 1st person view. Great graphics and audio. Worth it if you can get it on sale.
I recommend everyone who finish the game to read the story explain as I didnt understand it by my self, the game mechanic pretty much repeat itself the whole game, but I enjoy it
Beautiful game, the environments are fantastic. Only downside is it's very easy, but doesn't detract too much.
Great graphics, good story. very linear game worth every penny in the sale.

review_title: If I could rate 10 stars I would.
one_reviews_text: Hands down the most awesome experience I've ever had playing any game. Partly because I love VR tremendously but mostly because insomniacs out did themselves on this one. They obviously worked their butts off cause this game is Epic. Support these ridiculously good developers and buy this game. You will be super glad you did.

First of all, it's a third person game. So....I know VR can be enjoyed in third person (I loved Lucky's Tale), but this....environments are always the same. Atmosphere can be at times nice and deep, but the game is incredibly slow and repetitive. The fact that you just play with a normal controller doesn't really help immersion. VR is made for immersion and interaction, and this game doesn't use that, on top of everything gets boring after the first hour. Definitely one of my worst experiences with VR until now, sadly disappointed because it looked interesting and nice.
Does justice to the Lovecraftian premise, stunning soundtrack!

review_title: A solid, though short, Lovecraftian tale
one_reviews_text:
Clocking in around 3 hours, this action-adventure platformer weaves a solid tale that feels ripped straight from an H.P. Lovecraft anthology.  Minor issues with repetition and wonky platforming in sections are readily forgiven for the quality of the story and novelty of experience.  Well worth it, especially for those new to VR looking for a horror fix that relies on story more than jump scares.  
For those of you who experience an error code 'OVR75318303' when you try to launch, excluding the .exe in your virus scanner should allow it to boot.

I like VR for it's immersive effects and being able to use your hands in the games. However this game uses a controller and gives you a third person view. I found this to be wonderful also. To be able to sit in my office chair and see a life size toon in front of me  I control is great. The script for this game is well written. The story line was good and could be made into an awesome movie. The game offers tricky puzzels to get around in the enviroment (they give you clues) and the graphics are well down. I enjoyed this game very much and was glad I purchased it. I reccomend it.

Took me about 4.5 hours to finish on the medium difficulty. Starts off easy then gets harder as the game progresses. There are some slow parts but that's have games are that want to emphasize the story line. I thought it was a good experience overall.

What a truly great story based driven adventure/survival/horror title.
A lot of love has been put into this game and is best played with a controller.
There are plenty of 'wow look at that' and 'phew' experiences. A must have for vr.
No bad. Good atmospheric gameplay, monsters.

Many of the VR experiences I had are good, but not good enough that I'd forget about the tight strain on the edge of my face. This is one of the few that provide full immersion into the storyline and the gameplay. Recommended!

Tomb Rider+last of us=Edge of nowhere.Good graphics with great game design in the scenery and enemies,nice and immersive lore and simple but good gameplay plus a really good optimization.Much better than I expected before playing it.recomended

review_title: One of my best VR game purchases
one_reviews_text: In my opinion this is one of the best VR games out there.  This is really immersive and seems like the devs understood how to really utlize VR.

Not sure what I was thinking, but this title turned out to be amazing!  The story was entertaining and well choreographed, with spot-on voice acting, which helped break any monotony along the way.  Fun stuff!  I'll definitely be back after a month or two to try hard mode.
Amazing!
Awesome game. Was actually sad to see it end. Simply outstanding

just completed this game.have to say really enjoyed it.few probs with controllers not working ie.in crouch mode,fireing shotgun.nothing happens got really .frustrating.overcame it bye coming out of game then going back into it,controls can be a bit frustrating at first but when you get used to them it ok.more games like this pls.forgot to mention thought the ending was pretty lame

I just finished this game and I have to say I really enjoyed it. The over-the-shoulder camera was well done, and for a moderate intensity game, I never ended up feeling nautious.
Graphics were well done in my opinion, with great visitas, ice/underground caverns and little things to surprise you. And while I did have frame-rate issues 3/4 of the way through the game, it was smooth before and after that. But I am willing to blame my graphics card for that, not the game.  
I played and finished the game with Touch, but there were times were it was obvious to me a game controller was the superior option. If the game's settings would have allowed for a,b,x and y assignment, the touch controller would have been easier to use, and I would have died less (spoiler alert, you will likely die many times).

* The most recent update improves the usability of the Touch Controlers SIGNIFICANTLY!

Before the sale (i bought it 4 euro on the 87% sale) i though "third person action on VR, thats just silly". Now that i played it i feel terrible for paying only 4 euros! Because the game is AWESOME! I enjoyed it 10 times better than i did with Lone Echo. For some strange mind weirdness you can play for hours the third person games because there is no locomotion. I admit it takes out some of the immersion(i was watching terrible monsters eating my hero and i was like "mmmkay"), but you can still enjoy the VR  dark scenery. I bought the game on friday and i finished it on sunday playing lots of hours without getting tired. In other VR games i cant play more than 1 hour without a break. I really really enjoyed the game. Graphics=8/10, Sound=8/10, Gameplay=9/10
Pretty nice VR experience in a game that didn't really need VR.  Enjoyed the story.

I like this title a lot. My first ever 3rd person VR game and its pretty amazing to control your character this way. However, your flashlight is controlled with your headset which works great! This is not really a "horror" title, its more like Tomb Raider type of adventure. Touch controllers works great with this game.
Also people giving 1 star to this game with comments like "Controller does not work, how do I start?" need to be banned from reviewing games. This is not a forum. Sort out your crap PC first before leaving comments.
There was a lot of work to make a game like that, very impressed !

review_title: Definitely one of the better vr games
one_reviews_text:
It is a linear adventure game, the gameplay is alternating between enemy encounter, obstacle navigation and story bits. Gets a bit repetitive towards the end but overall very enjoyable and the 3rd person camera works surprisingly well. Normally it is easy for me to get motion sickness when the world moves around but I had no issues with this game.

Story is ok. Nothing amazing or new but it does the trick. I don't want to spoil it so I only say they could have done a better job to obfuscate the plot twist a bit better.

Awesome game! Very dense atmosphere, one of the best story lines I ever saw, especially for H.P. Lovecraft fans. Nice story twists, where you never know certainly whats real and whats madness. 
Also very good graphics.
A little bit repetetive gameplay, so more of 4,5 stars, but therefore a good game length.

This was my first 3rd person vr game. I was sceptical on how vr can work for 3rd person. I was wrong. It totally works (especially up close 3rd person games like this one - haven't yet tried the birds eye view type ones yet), & now I want more! Nice to sit on sofa & play a vr game. The gameplay was awesome, & I really enjoyed being immersed in this alien-like world whilst sitting on sofa. But I wish there was a way to revist any checkpoints I wish after completeing the game. Would love to re-explore, & find new ways to beat a check point. I also agree, there are some stupid, single brain celled reviewers who leave reviews that has nothing to do with the game. They need to be taught how to leave a review. It was worse on Google Cardboard games. E.g., someone left a 1 star rating because the game needed a controller (it was mentioned in description), & buyer didn't have one. WTF? What's that got to do with the game? Review the gameplay, not your hardware or cognitive limitations!

review_title: A great mix, makes a great VR game
one_reviews_text: First person view VR provides great immersion, Touch Controllers provides great object manipulation, 3rd person view provides great locomotion control... with great VR being a recipe that comes together by providing the right mix of the separate ingredients that currently work in VR. And the Edge of Nowhere VR recipe, that is made of ~20% VR immersion, ~10% object manipulation and ~70% locomotion control... makes for a great VR game despite being a 3rd person gamepad game, even if you purchased your Touch Controllers back in 2016. Noteworthy : The voices are fully translated (not just subtitled).

Definitely one of the best Rift games, it's generally a mix of horror + Tomb Raider inspired exploration. Runs perfectly with supersampling at 2.0 using GTX 1080. I was reluctant about buying this game because I read that Touch controls weren't working well - but Touch controls work just fine. It would be awesome if the developers would not show a gamepad to illustrate key/button mappings when using Touch, but that's a minor complaint. If you're careful, you won't die that much - I don't think the game is especially hard, it's simply a fantastic experience I wouldn't want to be without.

I bought it during the sale and i can say one thing after wanting to test play it for 5 minutes i ended up playing 4 hours in a row... nice scenary and graphics . game controls are not very complicated so its easy also to use it as a vr showcase for others. it does not have anything scare but the story is really detailed and nicely!

review_title: Nice graphics, but unplayable with touch
one_reviews_text: Nice game, looks nice and is atmospheric, but unfortunately the gameplay is ruined if you are using the touch controllers.  You have to use the joystick on the left controller and push the buttons on the left controller at the same time and then push the buttons on the right controller, which is pretty much impossible to get right.  The overall controls are not intuative at all and makes the game very frustrating and not fun.

Insomniac games are always fun to play. The game borrows some artstyle from Resistance games which is a good thing. I only wish it has graphics options available in menu. Other then that it is a great game for VR.

Had vr a few months lots on wave zombie/robot shooters was looking for a game to sit back and chill with xbox controller this is it didn't realize 3rd person would be so good on vr £7 on sale no brainer would happily pay more . It makes me realize gears of war would be amazing ! please more 3rd person vr games well done devs.Note to devs please add right stick rotate option .

WOW! I bought it a while back together with some other games and never really got into it up until now. And it turned out to be A REALLY GOOD GAME! Hope they make more of this kind of vr titles in the future as the story being told here is really polished, well driven and makes you want to go through the whole plot and see all the Lovecraftian spirit the authors put into it. 
I HIGHLY RECOMMEND it to anyone seeking a truly fleshed out vr adventure with a couple of scares here and there!
Well done Insomniac and thanks Oculus for vr games of such a good quality.

The Touch controller is not planned for this game. Clearly a last minute rewrite for the new oculus boundle as the game controller is not included any more. When you fall and keep a button pressed, then that button gets stuck for the next run. Sux if it is the A button, and you cannot exit the menu any more. Forget this game if you only have Touch.
Part walking simulator, part platformer, some puzzles and a little bit of shooting make for a great game and story.

Graphics are above average and the plot is compelling. Very story driven with a horror theme. Chilling is how ide describe the overall gameplay feel, with no real jump scares but plenty of intense dark overtones. Gameplay is sneaky heavy but not tedious. Took me 7 hours to complete and is a perfect game to introduce VR to friends without risk of the sickness from FPS locomotion that puts people off VR.

review_title: Nice game if you pick it up for under£10
one_reviews_text:
If you like tomb raider, you will most likely like this too. 

I did encounter a few controller issues. 

A: trying to play with touch controllers is aweful. Its designed for a console controller.
B: when I turned my xbox xontroller on, the game would not detect it and just complained that it needed a controller. This took a full restart to resolve.

Other than the initial controller issues, I really enjoyed the game. Took about 4 hours to complete but the experience was good and I felt it was worth it.

Graphics and setting gives me a real chilled feeling, while the albeit "on the rails" style of adventure gives a real sense of exploration and danger.  The ice climbing with picks really got my heart pumping on ocassion which I enjoyed.

I'm not far into the story yet but I have no hesitation in recommending this story based adventure.  For those who typiclly get motion sickness, the 3rd person view really dampens down the full loco feeling.  The voice acting is excellent also.

Thumbs up from me.

Picked this up for $5 dollars during the sale and its a great game for VR.  I had no idea that 3rd person in VR could be compelling, but it works really well and should pave the way for future 3rd person high budget games.

review_title: Nice story and good all round gameplay
one_reviews_text: The story isn't half bad and that ending. Graphics are good. It's does lack in places like the odd doors that look just 2D. Some surfaces are 2D looking and lack any tessellation. The game in whole looks good. It's oddly in third person and not first person. However it does pull it off well. I got a good 6 to 8 hours of play time. I did bump the SS to 2 using Tray tool and this helped clear up some long distance blur. Story is deep and can be comfusing, but enjoyable. The gameplay isn't half bad, however it does get repetitive and if it wasn't for the story would bore me.

review_title: Like a Tomb raider in VR !
one_reviews_text: At first, i was not convinced of such a gameplay in VR, but the scenario is good, voices are translated :) and graphics are quite good ! it works fine ! Support of Oculus Touch is well handled and very playable. Awesome gameplay ! give a try ! a must have for me ! (5/6 hours to finish)

... to see his literature transformed into such a marvellous 3D-game.

The nice thing about 3D is that I even wouldn't need all the action. Just walking through this world, putting pieces together and making both understanding and horror grow would be completely enough.

I was supprised by how much game play there was, as much of the VR apps are short and leave you feel abandond, while this had good graphics realistic charictor rendering and movments it did have a small flaw of feeling repetitive at time the whole run jump climb repeat scenario but when there were story sequenses I didn't feel like they just thru in cut scenes insto a side scroller and call it an amazing vr game... this is actually a great VR game. there are no options or side stories and completely linear but it is much better than other games in its price range and even better in higher ranges.

now for any and all negitives I can think are worth mentioning
This game was made for the xbox controller. so when climbing you use the X butto which is to close to the left hand touch controllers joystick, so can be tricky to jump and climb sometimes.

Motion sickness can be an issue if you dont periodically look at the charactor.

as i said can get repeditive at points.

I don't think 4 hours of play is short at this point in VR development as most game you can been in 20 minutes max unless we are talking strategic,war, board games 

sorry for the length just wanted you to know what your buying and that it may have small issues but I highly recommend

This game was much more immersive than I thought a 3rd-person view game would be. I have to echo everyone else's thoughts that this game was an amazing experience. This game was just the right level of VR scary for me. The scenery was beautiful, horrific, and extremely detailed. The voice acting was top-notch and it literally felt like I was actually in a horror movie.

That ending though.
Incredible.

review_title: 3.5 stars (if I could give half stars)
one_reviews_text:
This is a decent game. It could have been much better with a more interesting script. I love the Lovecraft universe, and this certainly teases that, but doesn't quite reach it. Don't get me wrong, there are some incredible moments with Lovecraftian legends (at full size!) and a decent vibe, but something felt lacking in the end. 

The gameplay itself was balanced and not annoying, if fairly standard. If this were a standard PC game, it'd be pretty run of the mill, VR certainly adds to it. 

The voice actors were superb, as were the sound effects and music. Graphics were fairly flat, low poly, and muted colors. Textures were lacking. I get the reasons behind this, but I've seen better in other games.

The ending felt abrupt, and jarring, and quite unsatisfying. I was expecting a more psychological and intellectual finish. 

I got this for $5 in the Friday the 13th sale, and as such, no regrets and it was generally enjoyable. Had I paid $40 I would have been disappointed. It took me 5.5 hrs to complete.

Really good.  Palms sweating.  Knuckles aching.  Couldn't stop playing for two hours.  Still have the very end left.   Awesome game.  I shamelessly got it on sale for 4.99.  It's worth much more than that.  I would give it a $25.99 price tag.
Insomniac delivered - great gameplay, story and atmosphere! Third person vr games works extremely well. More 3rd person vr games pls

review_title: Wish it lasted longer and gameplay
one_reviews_text:
This game is awesome! But not really worth it's price. I had it for 5€ and worth it, because it lasts 3h30. This game is situated in the Lovecraft universe and that is AMAZING! But by the end of it you wish to see more about it, about the monsters, story and more shooting action and less hiding. But that is my opinion. 
This game is scary, thrilling and the story is good enough ( wished there was more about the monsters ). 
Your surroundings will make you paranoid. 
graphically the game is very good and controls are nice and smooth. 
The plataform parts are nice and beautiful, beautiful views! 
A problem: This game has not repleability... :/
Btw: This game has the same storyline than Dead Space 1... Wich is good, cuz I liked it. 

Do I recommend this game? YES!!! YES!!! YES!!! But try to get it on sales. This team worked very very well on this game, but it is not worth full price. 

Summary:
+Graphics
+Story
+Controls
+Gameplay
+VR usage
+Scary at some moments

-Short and expensive for it's price
-No replayability
-Wished there was more about the Lovecrafts monsters
-Wished there was more shooting action

So this is a pretty good title. Game play and control were good, except I was not able to get it to work with the xbox controller. It did work fine with the Touch controllers though. The two things that I didn't like, no manual save points and couldn't adjust camera angle. There was several points were if i could adjust the camera I could look around better. But the game was fun even with this minor issues. And I think I recognized some of my fellow Miskatonic University grads!  :)

Saw the sale price and went for a punt! Blimey!!! opening 60 seconds and 2nd cut scene worth the entry price alone! Been in space for last few weeks with my OCULUS Buddy, so seeing the Antartic and penguins was a very refreshing change. Was not sure how I would handle 3rd person mode, but turns out, it's like trying to protect your best mate from instant death! The landscapes, sound and visuals all looked second rate in the promo!, but belive me once you get inside this experience, it will have you, hook, line and sinker! This is what VR is all about, give us a story and some stunning visuals to wander through! Not all of us want to blast away endless walls of enemys! As Oliver once said! "The foods crap and full of weevils!!" BUT...........more please!!! Grab a bargin!

review_title: Very mediocre game, extra star for VR.
one_reviews_text:
This is a decent enough game for a 1st gen early VR title.

Graphics are about on par with a phone game or maybe an original Xbox title, but it does have a large sense of scale in quite a few areas and also with some of the large enemies... which is always cool in VR.

Enemy design and story are very much typical Lovecraftian. 

Game play is alot of very (very) straightforward platforming/adventure mixed in with some really (really) basic stealth and occasional gun play.  I cant really stress how straightforward and basic the gameplay is, it is fun enough in a weird way, but very basic.

Game takes about 4 hours to complete which is about the right length of time, as it is over right before the simplistic repetitive gameplay wears out its welcome.

 Definitely would not cut it outside of VR, but makes a decent enough VR title.

Played it on a PC with a 1080ti, so I did have the max visuals (2x supersampling as well), they just arent very good despite what others say.

This game is a linear run-shoot-climb 3d platformer. It's similar to tomb raider somehow, in an arctic cave setting, with a storyline where a mad researcher finds some ancient creatures and feels the need to get into their space and kill them all. All salted with some scary scenes and memories. It was ok for 5€ sale, would be ok for 15 as well I think. For 30, I'm not sure.

Let me start off by saying I really enjoyed the graphics of the game. That and the music really set the mood. The majority of the gameplay is climbing, jumping, and sneaking, but there is a really good storyline here. I think there were only two jump scares in the game, but the whole thing was fairly creepy. This was made for seated play with the Xbox controller, which I won’t knock. It told a good story, kept me engaged, and made me tense at several intervals. Money well spent.

review_title: Spectacular good with a hint of mind F!
one_reviews_text: If you get that urge to play a game in VR while sitting down with an Xbox controller like I do, this is the game you want. Some completed it in 3 hours, I think in total I did it in about 5 hours. I took my time to soak in everything this game had to offer. Graphics, Acting and cut scenes Amazing and beautiful and gross at the same time. The story is hands down big ticket and the bang for your buck well depends, did you buy batman, pissed off, were you? NOT this game, this is worth every dollar you spend on this game!

This is Tomb Raider in VR but.... just badly done platforming. Ice climbing is WAY overused, like "seriously, ANOTHER slow, repetitive ice climbing section?" The platforming and jumping sections feel clunky and imprecise. 

This is a perfect example of a game where it's objectively mediocre but people give it a free pass because it's in VR.

There are some good parts, don't get me wrong. But overall it's a chore to get through, and the ENDING SUCKS. I won't give anything away, but it left me feeling angry and unsatisfied.

Which brings me to the story. It starts off like it could be interesting, and gets you curious.  But it never ties together, never makes any sense. 

Do yourself a favor and skip this one.

Fantastic game, works in Windows 7 and supports Gamepad. Excellent visuals, good pacing and well-balanced difficulty. VR games are generally too expensive for me, but I got this on sale for $5. At that price, this is hands-down the best game you can get. At full price, it is one of many good games. Very happy with purchase.

To be honest: this is one of the few VR games that can be considered as "real" game. Although it is still a bit too short (5-6 hours). Graphics are good, story is good and the gameplay with Controller just fits perfect for this game. It's a perfect balance between stealth and action. However - I got it on sale for just 5 bucks. Would say it's worth about 20. Full price games should be longer. 

Anyway - the game itself is great. Eveyone has to decide for himself if it's worth the price for a five to six hour experience.

I bought it on sale, INSANE price of 87% off. Overall is a very nice experience, feels like Tomb Raider, love the setting and the Lovecraftian style of monsters. The game is very demanding on CPU and GPU but I think is more CPU bounded than other rift games... had to play with default settings (Supersample 0.8x) and having a GTX 1070 is kinda a let down because graphics are good but simple, so it must be fault of my weak CPU(Laptop i7 6700hq) like on few other games.
***Spanish voice acting suck's in my opinion, I hope they can hire better voice actors in future and keep the latin spanish focus, as we are a bigger player base than Spain and her girls don't sound like very old ladies. xD

review_title: Good game but a bit long...
one_reviews_text: The game was fun and pretty basic.  The graphics were good and the story line was very good but the game got a bit tedious about two thirds of the way through.  But it was fun so it wasn't bad to get past the repeatative aspects of the game mechanics.  Some areas were very challenging and that made getting past them pretty satisfying.  I'd definately play this game if you haven't.

Well what can I say. I've been eyeballing this game for weeks. Last sale was only 1/2 price. Even at that price I was sorry I didnt pull the trigger. What a treat, AAA game at a give away price. Are you still there, buy the game already. Trust me on this, you will not be disappointed. The 2d video and screen shots do not do it justice. This has got to be the best bargain in VR this year. By the way, the touch controllers do work, best played with the Xbox controller due to button placement. If you use the xbox controller for this game do not activate your touch controllers before play. Neither will work.  Thanks Oculus.

Excellent all around game - period.   More games like this are so needed.  Not a demo - not a empty story - not a straight forward button masher but has plenty of action.  Has depth and engaging.  A must have!
This game has a lot to offer. Fully fleshed out and enough content to last a good while. This review joins the chorus of great reviews, so what are you doing? Just buy the game already!

The most exciting game I played so far with the rift. Thought 3rd person is not the right thing for VR initially...but after a few minutes of playing, the game and it's story really got me. Hope for more games of this kind in the future!

Do you like monsters? Are you a fan of horror games, The Thing or Lovecraft? Then you should play this game.

Don't read too much about the story, spoilers will ruin this adventure.
The game is a decent length and has a pretty good story. Even if the game wasn't VR it I would have purchased it and VR definatly adds to the experience.

Got it on sale for $5 and man it's a great game! Think of it like Tomb Raider meets The Thing but all in VR so it feels like you're there. Haven't played more than an hour, hence the 4/5 stars, but once I'm deeper in I'll prolly give it a solid five.

review_title: Uncharted last of us lovecraft recycled
one_reviews_text: I got this game on the recent sale for $19.99 USD and I am so happy I did not pay full price.  This game is just mediocre.  I played it on medium difficulty (can't imagine how boring easy would have been).  It's not great or memorable.  It's mostly by the numbers.  Stealth is throwing rocks and doing back stabs.  Platforming is either climbing or jumping.  Paths just open up to exactly where you needed to go.  Ava, your annoying fiance, leaves you and you go chasing after her.  You end up alone in the cold.  There's penguins!  You can't touch them.  You have a flashlight that moves when you move your head and Victor does the same, except when you're moving then he doesn't.  Rinse and repeat throughout.  I only played about 4 hours but it felt like 10.  That's not good.  It played fine without any crashes and it had SOME nice visuals, but otherwise pretty bland artic environment. Jump scares at least kept me from falling asleep.  I guess the game really missed the marking giving the player a sense of exploration.  I never felt that.  At least it plays well and isn't too long.  The last "kissing" scene was a saving grace.  Not sure why so many people give this 5 stars, play more games people and you'll see greatness versus mediocrity, which this is.

My only gripe is that two different corded Xbox One controllers weren't recognized as a 'gamepad' by this game, and the game also wouldn't recognize my Touch controllers until I unplugged the corded controller every time.

one_reviews_text: I liked the game. It's a simple platformer, with an interesting story. I bought this on sale so it was pretty cheap and it was definitely worth what I paid.
